{"step_by_step_thinking": "The palatoglossus muscle is a muscle of the tongue and soft palate. According to Document [2], the palatoglossus is the only tongue muscle derived from the fourth branchial arch. All the other muscles of the tongue derive from the occipital myotomes. Therefore, the palatoglossus does not develop from the occipital myotomes, lingual swelling of the first arch, third arch, or mesoderm of the sixth arch.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
